update.description:
Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

~~Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)~~ merged

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli)) and the ability to generate SDF from physics profiles.

Known issue(s):

In physics elements with elements of different types, e.g. `test/worlds/presets.world` has `preset1` which has `ode`, `simbody` and `bullet` blocks, `PresetManager` will attempt to set all parameters specified in the profile. An optimization would be to only set parameters for the engine that is specified in the `type` attribute of `physics`. Since this is not currently implemented, the test gives a lot of warnings, such as `[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:225] SetParam failed for [cfm] in physics engine simbody`.

~~The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for Simbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. (If/when [PR1473](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1473/) gets merged before this, I will complete the `PresetManager` test to include Simbody.~~ merged and simbody test integrated

~~For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.~~ Fixed by [PR1528](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1528/call-physicsengine-setparam-in-child/diff)

A unit test for `PresetManager` should be added to get to ~90% coverage.
update.title: `PresetManager` for physics library

~~Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)~~ merged

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli)) and the ability to generate SDF from physics profiles.

Known issue(s):

In physics elements with elements of different types, e.g. `test/worlds/presets.world` has `preset1` which has `ode`, `simbody` and `bullet` blocks, `PresetManager` will attempt to set all parameters specified in the profile. An optimization would be to only set parameters for the engine that is specified in the `type` attribute of `physics`. Since this is not currently implemented, the test gives a lot of warnings, such as `[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:225] SetParam failed for [cfm] in physics engine simbody`.

update.description:
Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

~~Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)~~ merged

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli)) and the ability to generate SDF from physics profiles.

Known issue(s):

In physics elements with elements of different types, e.g. `test/worlds/presets.world` has `preset1` which has `ode`, `simbody` and `bullet` blocks, `PresetManager` will attempt to set all parameters specified in the profile. An optimization would be to only set parameters for the engine that is specified in the `type` attribute of `physics`. Since this is not currently implemented, the test gives a lot of warnings, such as `[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:225] SetParam failed for [cfm] in physics engine simbody`.

~~The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for Simbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. (If/when [PR1473](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1473/) gets merged before this, I will complete the `PresetManager` test to include Simbody.~~ merged and simbody test integrated

~~For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.~~ Fixed by [PR1528](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1528/call-physicsengine-setparam-in-child/diff)

A unit test for `PresetManager` should be added to get to ~90% coverage.

content.raw: Because this is a recursive function, `_elem == NULL` is actually an end condition of the recursion. I can separate these checks so that there is an error message/code if `_preset` is NULL, but`_elem==NULL` is actually an expected condition (eventually). If you think this is too messy, I could restructure it so that the recursion happens in another function.
content.html: Because this is a recursive function, _elem == NULL is actually an end condition of the recursion. I can separate these checks so that there is an error message/code if _preset is NULL, but_elem==NULL is actually an expected condition (eventually). If you think this is too messy, I could restructure it so that the recursion happens in another function.

content.raw: ok, but to clarify, I don't think that this line that you highlighted is an error case; I'm just diverting the flow of the program to another function
content.html: ok, but to clarify, I don't think that this line that you highlighted is an error case; I'm just diverting the flow of the program to another function

content.raw: error message or code would help
content.html: error message or code would help

content.raw:
Previously this line did not exist and the lower one was:

```
this->dataPtr->presetProfiles[_name] = Preset(_name);
```

This assignment called the destructor of `Preset` and left the `dataPtr` of `Preset` null, which caused a segfault.
content.html:
Previously this line did not exist and the lower one was:

this->dataPtr->presetProfiles[_name] = Preset(_name);

This assignment called the destructor of Preset and left the dataPtr of Preset null, which caused a segfault.

content.raw: It is important to mention that the function could return a NULL in presence of errors.
content.html: It is important to mention that the function could return a NULL in presence of errors.

content.raw: Experience tells me that silently fall and return a NULL value is a call for errors.
content.html: Experience tells me that silently fall and return a NULL value is a call for errors.

content.raw: Maybe we can add an statement to check if the profile really exists and warn the user if not: "you are trying to remove a non existing profile".
content.html: Maybe we can add an statement to check if the profile really exists and warn the user if not: "you are trying to remove a non existing profile".

content.raw: Reading the method description, we are returning empty strings as the names of a created profile. This is not true, we are really using empty strings as an error code and no profile was created.
content.html: Reading the method description, we are returning empty strings as the names of a created profile. This is not true, we are really using empty strings as an error code and no profile was created.

content.raw: Any reason to use a Pointer instead of a normal variable here for `newPreset`?
content.html: Any reason to use a Pointer instead of a normal variable here for newPreset?

content.raw: Error messages in every if could help users to understand what went wrong.
content.html: Error messages in every if could help users to understand what went wrong.
